habitat: Deciduous forest soils near oak and beech trees; found across Canada, the U.S., Europe, Mediterranean, parts of eastern and southern Australia, and parts of Asia.
shortDescription: A highly prized, fragrant, edible mushroom, bright yellow, found on forest floors in summer and autumn.

identification.cap: Funnel-shaped, up to 10 cm diameter, wavy irregular margin, color light yellow to deep egg-yolk yellow, Often curved, occasionally joined at
identification.gills: Ridges that are forked, blunt-edged, same color as mushroom, wavy, decurrent
identification.sporePrint: Pale yellow to creamy white, sometimes with slight pinkish tinge

note: Important to distinguish from poisonous jack-o-lantern (Clitocybe illudens) which glows in the dark.
